page.title: 03THURSO
page.content: {Thurso}is a peaceful, friendly town of about 10,000 people in the north of Scotland. There are many people from outside {Caithness}living in the town. Most came when the United Kingdom{Atomic {Energy}Authority built an Atomic Reactor at nearby{Dounreay. An American communications base just west of Thurso also brought many American servicemen to live in the area. The town is a mixture of old and new buildings. The old town was a fishing and market centre built beside the river and the sea. The river mouth made a fine harbour for ships. After the expansion of{Thurso}many new shops and services were required. There is now a fine shopping centre with a pedestrian precinct and the town has good leisure facilities.
